plugins.name: tinyzine
plugins.description:
tinyzine is a plugin that simplifies zine creation, making the process more intuitive and enjoyable. Whether you're crafting a folded zine or a booklet, tinyzine provides an array of features to enhance your design workflow.


Features:

  1. Create: Effortlessly generate frames and layouts for folded or booklet zines. Customize everything from page size, name, and guides to page count, background, and text color.
  2. Layout: Quickly create a print-ready booklet layout with minimal effort by simply selecting frames sequentially.
  3. Rename: Automatically rename frames to save time, allowing you to generate layouts more efficiently.


Ideal for artists, designers, and DIY creators aiming to bring their zine ideas to life with ease
plugins.tagline: a plugin to streamline your zine creation process

plugins.name: Figmattack
plugins.description:
Figmattack: Your Ultimate Figma Learning Adventure Starts Here! 🚀


Welcome to the OPEN BETA of Figmattack, the first-ever Figma LMS plugin designed specifically for designers of all levels. Whether you're just starting out or you're a seasoned pro, Figmattack offers an exciting and interactive way to sharpen your skills, take on new challenges, and grow as a designer—all within Figma!


Why Try Figmattack?


1. Gamified Learning Stages 🎮

Explore dungeons with progressively challenging stages—Easy, Medium, and Hard. Each dungeon tests your design skills with hands-on Exercise Stages, engaging Quizzes, and fast-paced Timebox Stages. It’s not just learning, it’s an adventure!


2. Personalized Onboarding

When you start, Figmattack adapts to your current level—beginner, intermediate, or expert. You’ll get personalized challenges that help you improve exactly where you need it most.


3. Curated Knowledge Base 📚

Access a handpicked selection of design resources and insights to support your learning journey. Whether you’re tackling a new concept or refreshing your knowledge, our knowledge base is there to guide you.


Coming Soon to Figmattack!


We’re in OPEN BETA, and that means new features are on the horizon:


  1. Leaderboard: Compete with other designers, track your progress, and rise to the top.
  2. Learning Paths: Follow structured paths that guide you from beginner to expert.
  3. Community Features: Join challenges, share tips, and collaborate with other designers within Figmattack.


Join the Figmattack Community on Discord!


We're constantly improving, and we want you to help shape Figmattack. If you encounter any bugs, have ideas for improvements, or just want to connect with other designers on the same journey, we’d love to hear from you!


Join Our Discord and be part of the growing Figmattack community! Share your experience, give feedback, and help us build the future of design learning together.


Get Started with Figmattack Today!


Don’t wait—join the adventure now and start leveling up your design skills inside Figma! This is your chance to experience Figmattack in its early stages, give your feedback, and watch as new features and stages are added in real-time.


Install Figmattack on Figma and dive into your first design challenge now!


Disclaimer: As we're in OPEN BETA, not all features are available yet, and there may be bugs or areas for improvement. Your feedback is crucial in making Figmattack the best learning tool for designers, so don’t hesitate to reach out and share your thoughts!

accepted.name: Sacha Perathoner
accepted.description: Looking for the perfect fit between Users Needs & Business Objectives.

plugins.tagline: Unlock your design potential

plugins.name: Figscreen - Screenshot Websites
plugins.description:
Figscreen – Website Screenshots in Figma


Figscreen is a Figma plugin that lets you import website screenshots directly into your canvas. It’s a tool built to simplify the process of collecting and organizing web references.


Features

  1. Bulk Import: Capture up to 25 websites at once
  2. High-Quality Screenshots: Supports Retina resolution
  3. Custom Sizes: Choose from preset device sizes or set custom dimensions (320px to 1920px)
  4. Auto Layout: Screenshots are arranged and labelled on the canvas
  5. Full-Page Support: Captures entire web pages, including lazy-loaded sections
  6. Responsive Views: Capture desktop, tablet, and mobile layouts


How to Use

  1. Paste one or more URLs (must include “https://”)
  2. Choose device types or set custom dimensions
  3. Click “Import Screenshots”
  4. Screenshots will appear on your canvas, organized and ready to use


Notes

  1. Works with public websites (no login required)
  2. Captures full pages, including dynamic content
  3. Upcoming features: option to hide banners, pop-ups, and chat widgets


If you have any questions, contact: support@figscreen.com

Found a bug? Report it here: figscreen.com/feedback
plugins.tagline: Capture, Import, Display – Up to 25 Sites at Once

plugins.name: Color Analyzer
plugins.description:
Effortlessly extract and display color values from your designs. This plugin automatically updates text layers with HEX and RGB values from a selected frame or reference layer.


Features include:

  1. Extracts color from frame fill or 'ref color' layer
  2. Updates text layers named 'hex' or 'rgb' with corresponding values
  3. Optional auto-contrast feature adjusts text color for readability
  4. Works with any frame, including those with auto layout
  5. Streamlines color documentation in your design files


Perfect for creating color palettes, style guides, or quickly referencing color values in your designs. Boost your workflow efficiency and ensure color consistency across your projects with this easy-to-use plugin.

plugins.name: Paster
plugins.description:
Access advanced pasting functionality with the ability to paste multiple layers simultaneously.


Features

  1. Paste or move layers inside a different frame, maintaining their original positions.
  2. Swap selection with copy, preserving the selection properties.
  3. Replace selection with copy, inheriting the copy properties.
  4. Paste only the properties that matter.


Available properties

  1. Absolute position: supports pasting only x or y.
  2. Auto layout
  3. Corner radius
  4. Effects
  5. Fills
  6. Interactions
  7. Name
  8. Opacity
  9. Rotation
  10. Position (relative): supports pasting only x or y.
  11. Size: supports pasting only width or height
  12. Strokes
  13. Text characters


Soon

  1. Layout grids
  2. Resizing options, like Hug and Fill.
  3. Constraints
  4. Font properties: #TBD
  5. Blend modes
  6. Export settings


Shortcuts

You have to assign them, and it works only on macOS.

  1. Control–Command-C: Copy selection
  2. Control–Command-V: Paste in place
  3. Shift-Control–Command-V: Move in place
  4. Control–Command-S: Swap with copy
  5. Control–Command-R: Replace with copy


Notes

  1. Paste strokes will ignore mixed stroke caps (e.g. rounded + arrow)
  2. Triggering undo after using 'Replace with copy', will prevent the plugin from closing. Reported to Figma - waiting for a solution.
  3. "View logs" is an experimental features available only to "Replace with copy".
plugins.tagline: Choose the properties you want to paste

plugins.name: Logo Light
plugins.description:
Transform Color Logos to Clean White Versions


Logo Light is a powerful Figma plugin that quickly converts any color logo or image into a clean, professional white version with transparent background—perfect for dark backgrounds, presentations, and mockups.


Key Features

✨ Instant Transformation - Convert any color logo to white with a single click

🖼️ Supports All Image Formats - Works with JPEG, PNG, SVG, and any other image format in Figma

📤 PNG Output - Creates clean PNG files with transparency for maximum flexibility

🎛️ Advanced Controls - Fine-tune the result with contrast and threshold adjustments

🔍 Preview - See your white logo in real-time against a dark background

🎯 Multiple Modes - Choose from three conversion methods for perfect results:


Luminance - Best for detailed logos with gradients

Silhouette - Ideal for solid logos and simple shapes

Threshold - Perfect for high-contrast conversion with clean edges


Why You Need This Plugin

Designers frequently need white logo versions for dark mode interfaces, mockups, and presentations. Instead of manually tracing or recreating logos, Logo Light automates this process with precise results in seconds. It works with any image format, including JPEG files that typically don't support transparency, and outputs clean PNGs with transparent backgrounds.

How to Use


Select any image or logo in your Figma document (JPEG, PNG, SVG, etc.)

Click "Generate Logo" in the plugin

Adjust settings to perfect the result

Click "Create in Figma" to add the white version to your document


The generated white logo maintains the exact proportions of your original and is placed right next to it for easy access.

Perfect For


Creating dark mode versions of websites and apps

Converting JPEGs and other non-transparent formats to clean white PNGs

Designing presentation templates with consistent branding

Building mockups with white logo variations

Preparing press kits with logo alternatives

Maintaining brand asset libraries with all logo variants


Feedback and Support

We're constantly improving Logo Light based on user feedback. If you have suggestions, encounter any issues, or need assistance, please reach out to us via our support email or website.

Transform your logos in seconds with Logo Light — the essential tool for every designer's toolkit!
plugins.tagline: Transform color logos to white with a single click

plugins.name: Flow Text Into Components
plugins.description:
“Flow Text Into Components” is a convenient Figma plugin designed to help you easily update text across multiple components in your design projects. This plugin simplifies the process of populating text into components, allowing you to save time and maintain consistency in your designs.


How to Use:


1.Set the text layer names in the master component and ensure the layer names in the instances match.


2.Prepare the text you want to flow into the components, separated by line breaks.


3.Open the plugin and select the group of components where you want to flow the text.


4.Enter the text you want to flow into the plugin.


5.Press the Update button.


If the plugin does not function as expected, check that the layer names in the master component and the instances are aligned. The plugin will not work if the layer names in the instances are inconsistent.
plugins.tagline: Instantly fill components with the right text

A simple plugin to help get the brain waves flowing as you synthesise sticky notes from workshops or brainstorming sessions.


Key features:

  • Scale sticky notes to all be the same width and the text size will scale too, no more randomly large or small sticky notes causing havoc when trying to align things nicely ✨
  • Control how many sticky notes wide you want your tidied bundle to be
  • Set the spacing between sticky notes when they're tidied, and manually adjust this using the built in pink-line spacing tools native to FigJam
  • See the width of your selection so that you can control how the notes will tidy
  • Keep things fresh and explore different perspectives - the order of the notes will randomly change each time, so you're not stuck reading the same top notes from the same person each time you go to synthesise a new group of notes


~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~

plugins.name: Tabletop
plugins.description:
Play board games and card games, right in Figma! This plugin helps with card management, dice rolling, hidden information, and general usability.


Open the playground Figma file for pre-made cards, tokens, and dice!


Features

  1. Sneak a peek at any card or token by selecting it while it is face-down. You will get a preview of the front of the card in your plugin window.
  2. See how many objects you currently have selected.
  3. Flip any number of cards or tokens that you have selected.
  4. Roll any number of dice that you have selected.
  5. Stack objects - this aligns them horizontally and offsets them by 1px vertically, randomizes the layer order, and flips them face-down.
  6. Shuffle objects - this randomizes the layer order of every object you have selected.
  7. Expand a stack of objects - this lays them out side-by-side and flips them face-up, allowing you to quickly see all objects in a stack.
  8. When you select any object, automatically bring it to the top of the layer hierarchy so it appears on top of other objects.


Custom Card & Token Preparation

  1. Create a card or token component that contains a layer named "Front" and a layer named "Back".
  2. Duplicate the component into as many instances as you need for that particular card/token.
  3. Now you can use the Tabletop plugin to manipulate the instances of your cards or tokens!
  4. Optional: Export a PNG image of your "Front" layer, paste it into your component beneath the other layers, and rename it "Preview". This will speed up the preview image that is generated in the plugin when the object is selected.


Custom Dice Preparation

  1. Create a die component that contains at least 2 layers named "Face".
  2. Duplicate the component into as many instances as you need.
  3. Now you can use the Tabletop plugin to roll your dice!


Feedback Needed!

I'm actively working on this plugin, so please leave comments with feedback and I'll try to refine and add features accordingly.

accepted.name: Colin Brandt
accepted.description:
Full-time product designer at Microsoft
Free-time game designer

plugins.name: marketgoo copies
plugins.description:
Plugin to sync copies from Google Spreadsheet to Figma.


How it works?

  1. Create a Google SpreadSheet with two columns. The first column is the copy id, the second column the copy value.
  2. Publish the document to the web (File > Publish to the web) and copy the public URL.
  3. In your Figma document, create text layers using the ids in the Google SpreadSheet as names.
  4. Run marketgoo copies plugin and paste the public URL of your Google SpreadSheet document.
  5. All content of the text layers with the same name as the ids in the Google SpreadSheet will be updated with the final copies.
  6. After editing any copy in the Google Spreadsheet document, just run the plugin again to update the copies in Figma.
  7. Running the plugin after selecting any layer, will update only the selected text layers (instead of the whole document).


Features

  • You can use dynamic variables with the notation {{ varname }} in your copies. The plugin will ask you for the final value.
  • You can use the HTML tag <br> to force a line break.
  • Any other HTML tag will be removed in Figma, but used to detect the ranges of all styles in the a text layer. For example: Hello <strong>world</strong>.
  • The "Reset layer names" command is useful to un-sync copies to the spreadsheet document.
  • The "Get missing copies" command list all text layers whose names do not appear in the spreadsheet. Useful to discover and sync new copies.

plugins.name: Variables Inspector
plugins.description:
Variables Inspector is a powerful tool for design system creators and UI designers working with complex interfaces. It helps analyze, export, and import tokens while detecting issues in variables and components.


Features:


  1. Comprehensive Token and Component Statistics – collections, modes, linked components, auto-layouts, and more.
  2. Token Analysis – identifies unlinked elements (padding, border, fill, grid) and helps fix them.
  3. Export & Import Variables – save JSON files and use them across different Figma projects.
  4. Design System Optimization – analyze text styles, duplicates, grids, and used fonts.


Export & Import Variables – The Core Feature of the Plugin


The “Export & Import Variables” function is designed to simplify the management of design tokens and variables within Figma, ensuring seamless collaboration, consistency, and reusability across different projects and files.


Why is this feature important?


Figma’s variables and design tokens are essential for maintaining scalability and uniformity in design systems. However, manually transferring or updating them between files can be a tedious and error-prone task. This feature allows users to effortlessly export all variable data to a JSON file and import it into another Figma file, enabling a smooth, automated workflow for design teams.


Exporting Variables (Save & Share Your Tokens)


The Export Variables functionality lets you save all your Figma design tokens and variables in a structured JSON format. This ensures that all color, spacing, typography, effects, and other tokens remain intact when shared across projects.


Steps:


  1. Click the “Export Variables” button in the plugin interface.
  2. The plugin will collect all existing variable collections, modes, and tokens in the current Figma file.
  3. A structured JSON file is generated and downloaded automatically.
  4. You can now store, share, or use this file in other projects or with your team.


Import Variables (seamless integration into any file with the same token collections but different values)


The Import Variables feature allows users to load and apply a previously saved JSON file containing variables. This ensures that design teams can quickly synchronize tokens between multiple files without manually recreating them.


Steps:


  1. Click on the “Import Variables” button.
  2. Upload a previously exported JSON file.
  3. The plugin will read the token data and match it with the current Figma document.
  4. All variable collections, tokens, and values are automatically applied.
  5. Your design system remains consistent without manual effort.


Key Benefits:


  1. Instant Transfer – Move variables between files effortlessly.
  2. Design Consistency – Maintain token integrity across projects.
  3. Backup & Versioning – Save and restore previous variable states.
  4. Team Collaboration – Easily share tokens with other designers or developers.
  5. Cross-Project Compatibility – Use the same token library in different files.


This feature is essential for design teams working on large-scale design systems or UI component libraries where variable consistency is crucial. Whether you’re a UI/UX designer, developer, or design system manager, the Export & Import Variables feature will save you time and effort in maintaining a well-structured, scalable design framework.


Optimize your design system and simplify token management with Variables Inspector!

plugins.name: TagIt: Tags Manager
plugins.description:
TagIt is a Figma plugin designed to streamline the process of organizing and managing tags for design elements within Figma documents.


Buy me coffee


  • Assign Tags: Easily assign tags to any node in the document, including frames, groups, or individual elements.
  • One-Click Selection: Quickly select all nodes associated with a specific tag with just one click, facilitating easy editing and synchronization.
  • Create and Edit Tags: Create new tags on the fly or modify existing ones to tailor the tagging system to your workflow.
  • Color Customization: Assign colors to tags for visual differentiation and organization.
  • Reorder Tags: Arrange tags in the desired order to maintain organization and hierarchy.
  • CSV Import and Export: Seamlessly import and export tags via CSV files for efficient bulk management.

plugins.name: Table text plugin
plugins.description:
Description

The Table text plugin allows designers to streamline the process of populating table components in Figma with comma-delimited data. Users can paste their data directly into the plugin’s interface, and the plugin will parse and populate the corresponding text layers in table cells. If additional rows are required, the plugin dynamically generates them based on the input data, ensuring a seamless fit within the existing table structure.


Key features

  1. Data input: Easily paste comma-delimited data into the provided text area. Supports handling data with embedded commas by using double quotes (" ") as delimiters.
  2. Dynamic row creation: Automatically generates new rows if the input data exceeds the existing table row count in Figma.
  3. Header matching: Maps data headers to corresponding Figma table cells based on their names, ensuring precise data alignment.
  4. Text layer updates: Identifies text layers named text within table cells and updates their content with the provided data.
  5. Guided setup: Includes a detailed Readme section to help users format data correctly and prepare their Figma file for efficient use of the plugin.


Best practices

  1. Prepare data in tools like Google Sheets and export it to a comma-delimited format.
  2. Ensure table headers in Figma match the column names in the data for accurate mapping.
  3. Define rows as local components in Figma and name them sequentially (e.g., Row 1, Row 2).


How to videos

I've created a series of video walkthrough to accompany the Figma playground file to highlight how the plugin works and how best to utilise it.

  1. Introduction
  2. Walkthrough
  3. Demo


Use the playground file to play with the capabilities of the plugin, as shown in the videos above.


This plugin simplifies data handling for table-based designs, saving time and ensuring consistency in Figma projects.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly transform CSV data into Figma table rows

plugins.name: RealSize Plugin
plugins.description:
RealScale is a Figma plugin that allows designers to view their designs at real-world size directly on the canvas. It automatically scales the viewport based on the PPI (pixels per inch) of your display, giving you an accurate representation of how your designs will appear on real devices. Simply install the plugin, select a layer and run the plugin.


How to use:

  1. Select a layer
  2. Activate the RealScale plugin.
  3. Enter the display details (resolution and screen size).
  4. Enter the target display details.
  5. Enjoy viewing your design in true-to-life dimensions!


Note: No subscription required.

Happy writing :)
